bug.author: ohdearaugustin
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Streamlit binds per default to *:8501 and :::8501. The only protection it uses is CORS. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Set browser.serverAddress to 127.0.0.1 $ streamlit hello $ ss -tulpn | grep stream
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behaviour:</denchmark-h>
The program should bind to the specified IP Address. The option browser.Address should bind Streamlit to the defined IP Address and not to all interfaces. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behaviour:</denchmark-h>
After the start of the program it show: You can now view your Streamlit app in your browser. URL: <denchmark-link:http://127.0.0.1:8501>http://127.0.0.1:8501</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>tcp LISTEN 0 128 *:8501 *:* users:(("streamlit",pid=11111,fd=6)) tcp LISTEN 0 128 :::8501 :::* users:(("streamlit",pid=11111,fd=7)) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.49.0 Python version: Python 2.7.9 virtualenv OS version: Debian GNU/Linux 8 (Jessie)
If needed I can provide all installed python libraries. <denchmark-h:h2>Corresponding Code</denchmark-h>
lib/streamlit/server/Server: Line 121 <denchmark-code>try: app.listen(port) break </denchmark-code>
If wanted I would add an Option to configure the ListenAddress.

comments.comment: Just a fly-by comment: browser.address may not be the right config option. That one is used to tell the browser (in some very specific cases) which address Streamlit lives in. But what you're asking for is for the server to only bind to a specific address. So perhaps we should create a new server.address config option instead.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tvst>@tvst</denchmark-link> yeah server.address would definitely be a more appropriate name. I will setup my development environment next week and work on it when my time allows me.
